title: Blue Hawaiian
description:
This website was built by myself and a senior colleague over the course of about 6 months. Blue Hawaiian is the largest helicopter touring company in Hawaii. We created a feature-rich platform that offers detailed information and booking options for helicopter tours across all four major Hawaiian islands - Oahu, Maui, Kauai, and the Big Island​​ and uses a custom booking engine.


Developed a prototype for an automatic weights and balances system for Blue Hawaiian Helicopters that optimized passenger seating based on weight distribution, enhancing aircraft stability. Though budget constraints prevented official implementation, I pursued the project independently. A simplified JavaScript version is accessible on my GitHub.
excerpt: Laravel website with booking capabilities for Hawaii's largest helicopter touring company.

title: Sundance Helicopters
description: I was responsible for the maintenance and periodic redesigns of this site for over 2 years, until sadly, due to covid19, it shut down in 2020.

title: Fractal Markets Lab
excerpt: My python stock market laboratory, complete with hurst exponent calculators, VIX calculator, trend chasers, correlations scanners, and more.

title: MacKinney Systems Inc
excerpt: I do ongoing maintenance work for the great MacKinney Systems, a mainframe company.

excerpt: I help with ongoing site maintenance for Mineral Auctions

title: Vultron JS
description: I am currently developing Vultron, a comprehensive framework based on Electron designed to empower developers with MVC expertise in creating self-contained desktop applications. Vultron simplifies Electron's complexities, providing a developer-friendly environment reminiscent of Rails or Laravel. A key feature is its compatibility with SQL databases, originally employing Knex and Bookshelf as database ORMs until the emergence of a superior alternative, Prisma. In addition to these features, I've engineered an IPC API to facilitate seamless interaction with a Vue frontend integrated with Tailwind CSS. This project underlines my commitment to creating tools that enhance developer productivity and experience.
excerpt: Electron MVC framework using Vue, Prisma and TailwindCSS

title: Rugdoctor
description: Led the overhaul of Rug Doctor's Ruby on Rails API, which serves as the core connection to all front-end clients. Addressed significant technical debt and scalability issues inherited from previous designs. Simultaneously developed new features including an online order-driver delivery system. Successfully rebuilt critical API components, notably the refunds process, rectifying previous development failures.

title: VIX Volatility Calculator
description: I engineered a program capable of calculating the CBOE VIX Volatility number for any stock, marking, to my understanding, the most accurate implementation of the VIX equation available on GitHub, and the only program that allows a user to run the equation on any stock. The process of meticulously understanding the underlying math and implementing the program, completed over two weeks, was extremely interesting and I dare say, “fun”.
excerpt: Run the VIX equation in Python on any stock

title: Congress Stock Trades Bot
description:
As a passionate explorer of stock market complexities and statistical math, I developed an array of stock trading programs aimed at analyzing market volatility and potential trading patterns. These programs were subsequently utilized in the creation of a Twitter bot, with the primary intent of posting outputs of my various programs. A notable feature of this bot was its ability to extract and tweet stock transactions made by Congress members, as disclosed under the Stock Act. This unique integration garnered significant public interest, leading to an invitation to discuss the bot on the KWOS Morning Radio Show.


While the bot is no longer maintained as of 2022 due to superior alternatives emerging, I take pride in this pioneering endeavor. Many of the initial programs and the Twitter bot's codebase are open-sourced on my GitHub account under the fractal-markets-lab repository.
excerpt: Twitter bot that tracks congressional stock trades

title: Github Language Statistics
description: Personal: A Ruby gem that hooks to the Github API, parses all projects, and returns language statistics. Code used on this site.

title: Marketplacer
description: As a central developer on the "Cerberus" platform within the highly sophisticated Marketplacer ecosystem, I contributed significantly to the development of a triad of interconnected Rails applications catering to Marketplacer, Shopify, and Adobe Commerce. These applications were unified by a robust event-driven RailsEventStore engine listening for events across all connectors. Our team adhered to rigorous test-driven development practices, aiming for comprehensive code coverage for all new features. Despite the platform's complexity, the codebase was exceptionally clean, providing me a profound understanding of the importance and implementation of 'clean code'.
excerpt: Large event-driven Rails API system connecting a fleet of ecommerce websites
